definition: lit. head broken and blood flowing/fig. badly bruised
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of
blood/colloquial pr. [xie3]/CL:滴[di1],片[pian4]
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: Let children play as they will unless they break their heads.
sentences.chinese: 放手让孩子玩，摸爬滚打，不头破血流就可以。

sentences.english: Monica and Ross compete for the "Geller Cup."
sentences.chinese: 莫妮卡和罗斯为家族的“盖勒杯”争得头破血流。

sentences.english: Heng beat up sea to be charged with head broken and bleeding.
sentences.chinese: 天恒打升海至头破血流，被警方控告。

sentences.english: While this type of entrepreneurs often failed in reality.
sentences.chinese: 但这一类企业家在现实生活中却常常碰得头破血流。

sentences.english: Many artificial this touches the head break bloods all useless.
sentences.chinese: 许多人为此碰得头破血流都无济于事。

definition: covered all over with cuts and bruises/beaten black and blue/be a mass of bruises
a bloody nose and a swollen face/badly battered
a black eye (idiom); serious injury to the face/fig. a setback/a defeat
same as 稀爛|稀烂[xi1 lan4]
to suffer a crushing defeat (idiom)/in a pitiful state/in a complete mess/to roll (with laughter)
battered and exhausted/stuck in a dilemma
to be looking for one's teeth all over the floor/(fig.) to get beaten up badly/to beat the crap out of (sb)
failed and wiped over the floor (idiom); to fail utterly/a crushing defeat/beaten and in a hopeless position
head and face filthy with grime (idiom)/covered in dirt/dejected and depressed
to obtain by an effort/to strive to get sth
lit. you die, I live (idiom); irreconcilable adversaries/two parties cannot coexist
to see stars/dazed
bruised/riddled with scars
to kneel and beg forgiveness
confused/distracted
lit. torn body and crushed bones (idiom)/fig. to die horribly/to sacrifice one's life
